F5 empowers creators of the new digital world The F5 Digital Sales organization is a global sales organization with an opportunity to be a tremendous revenue growth engine for the company. The F5 solutions, bridges the gap between NetOps and DevOps with multi-cloud application services that span from code to customer. This role is part of an exciting new team that is at the forefront of establishing cutting-edge opportunistic sales motions leveraging AI, digital marketing, big data and analytics to drive impactful and targeted sales coverage. The F5 Multi-Cloud Application Services Platform enables enterprises undergoing digital transformation to modernize legacy, monolithic applications, as well as deliver new, microservices-based applications. Companies like Netflix, Starbucks, and McDonalds rely on F5 to reduce costs, improve resiliency, and speed innovation. F5 is searching for an enthusiastic, eager-to-learn Business Development Representative (BDR) to join the growing Digital Sales team in Singapore. If you are an early aspirant in your sales career or looking to work in a fast paced dynamic work environment, F5 is the perfect place for you! This position requires previous experience in an outbound role interacting with C-suite buyers. BDR candidates during the interview should not only be able to demonstrate the ability to comprehend F5 Solutions, but also the ability to pitch this effectively to new customers. They will also be expected to articulate how they would be creative and thoughtful in their approach to create market interest and solicit a response from prospects. This position is an in-office role that requires working from the F5 office in Singapore, supporting the Indonesia market. However, due to the ongoing COVID pandemic, this role will require working from home as stipulated by the local country and company mandates. Responsibilities Schedule highly qualified meetings from outbound campaigns within a very select group of targeted major accounts. Mapping the organization hierarchy, identifying new buying centers and engaging different personas within the account (NetOps, SecOps, DevOps, Cloud Architects, Security and Fraud leaders etc) Working closely with Account Executives to refine ideas and develop new strategies to deliver F5’s message to our buyers Leverage prospecting tools such as Salesforce’s High Velocity Sales, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Lusha or other local social media and outbound calling techniques to schedule meetings with identified target accounts Effectively turn prospects into opportunities and revenue pipeline by qualifying through the PANT criteria (Pain, Authority, Need and Timeline) Collaborate with marketing, field sales, and product teams to facilitate new programs, messaging, campaigns, and offerings Communicate and engage through video conferencing and navigate phone systems, voicemail systems, front desk operators and administrative assistants to reach intended business contacts Ensure opportunity handoffs to sales are successful and exceed the customer's satisfaction Ensure reporting and communications are frequent and bi-directional Exhibit qualities of overachievement, self-motivation, good teamwork, and positive attitude Meet and exceed minimum activity metrics: 50 Dials, 10 conversations, and 50 emails per day Qualifications BS/BA degree or equivalent work experience Min 3 years of sales prospecting experience through social media, cold callings, emails and writing qualification notes Core sales skills related to initiating conversations, uncovering basic needs, connecting needs to high level F5 solution and driving interest in continued discussion with sales team members Skill in using Salesforce CRM tool for leads management, prospecting, emailing and calling is a must Previous experience with technology companies selling SaaS, IaaS, or PaaS is a plus Fluency in Bahasa and English is mandatory F5s culture is built upon our core values: progress, excellence, openness, and curiosity. We’re a growing company with a startup feel and products that are chosen for high performance and efficiency by innovators around the world. If our team has one thing in common, it’s our passion for a multi-cloud application services and dedication to a global suite of products that’s loved by a loyal base of F5 fans for over 20 years. Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane, not exceeding 10% of the time spent traveling. If this sounds like you, we want to meet you!

Sales, Distribution and Business Development plays a vital role in understanding and meeting customer needs by offering the right solutions through the right channels to the right customer segments.  The team is responsible for implementing distribution strategy, driving the delivery of market leading personal banking customer experiences and thereby maximising customer satisfaction. We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as an AVP, Premier Direct Relationship Manager. Principal Responsibilities Manage clients virtually with some face to face client interaction, primarily through the telephone and emails, managing our highest value clients where professionalism, client focus and strong understanding of the fundamentals of financial planning are critical to the success of the business Attend to client service requests through the telephone and email, on both service and sales matters Execute instructions from clients promptly to service level agreements and accurately, following up on any pending items, responding to customers’ request, queries and complaints promptly, and working closely with other departments to ensure that customers instructions and requests are executed correctly and followed up in a timely manner Refer potential customers who require or are keen in financial planning and products to license Relationship Managers Build effective relationships with clients to retain and develop sustainable relationships Maintain highest standard of excellence in client service Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience Some proven and progressive financial services or retail sales experience or equivalent Evidence of strong service experience in banking industry Relationship management experience with Premier clients Strong communication, client focus and influencing skills Understanding of business banking client segment, products and services Clear view on how to work with Compliance, Credit & Risk and Internal Control to ensure a balanced risk operating environment Able to communicate well in English and local languages To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required. You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC. http://www.hsbc.com/careers HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Vice President, Campaign Management. Principal Responsibilities Drive mass affluent proposition acquisition and wealth sales / volume growth for both globally minded onshore and offshore customers via integrated marketing activities (ATL, BTL, digital, event, partnership) Identify and understand the wealth needs of affluent segment to design and rollout acquisition and wealth marketing campaigns to grow investment uptake of existing and new globally minded customers. Increase consideration and adoption of wealth products amongst existing and new customers through wealth marketing strategy and initiatives delivering increased wealth sales and volume. Drive acquisition of mass affluent proposition for onshore and offshore new to bank customers using both digital acquisition and offline channels Plan, lead and deliver insights-led campaigns and marketing strategies and initiatives in an agile manner to support business priorities and enhance customer journey across all channels.  Identify opportunities to test and learn marketing initiatives, including marketing innovation Discover, identify and understand the full life cycle of the affluent segment and their needs using data analytics to develop marketing initiatives to increase acquisitions, retention, engagement and penetration of affluent segment Work with various creative, media and digital agencies and manage and lead end to end campaign planning, evaluation and reporting Work independently to nurture and manage internal (business, compliance, legal, group communications, direct) and external (agencies, production, partners) stakeholder relationships and ensure alignment with business priorities Requirements Agile and a self-starter with a passion for marketing and/or digital and able to work under pressure with a positive spirit have a performance driven attitude and mind-set with an ability to meet targets and KPIs be a team player yet able to work independently and lead on projects be able to influence, manage and build relationships with multiple stakeholders with the proposed Marketing strategy and plan be creative & innovative with alternate options on delivering an effective Marketing plan be energetic, versatile and be constantly ready to accept to perform duties beyond stated scope have sound knowledge of integrated marketing especially digital and social marketing have offshore marketing knowledge, preferred but not essential To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required. You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC. www.hsbc.com/careers HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Job_Title: VP, Senior Digital & Technology Audit Manager (Section Manager), Group Audit
Job_Descriptions: VP, Senior Digital & Technology Audit Manager (Section Manager), Group Audit OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Audit provides objective assurance that the Group functions effectively to accomplish its objectives within the established risk appetite. We adopt a risk-based systematic approach to evaluate and provide recommendations to improve the effectiveness of internal control, risk management and governance processes. Key Responsibilities: 1. Assist the Head, Digital & Technology Audit in the delivery of his/ her role and responsibilities. 2. Prepare the audit plan for the areas under his/her charge and monitor the progress/ achievement of the audit plan. 3. Manage a team of Digital & Technology auditors in ensuring that audits are delivered on time, on budget, to the required standard (i.e. audit work meets audit objectives, working papers and reports are adequately prepared) and to provide value to the Bank. 4. Work in conjunction with the Digital & Technology Audit Managers in communicating audit findings and achieving agreement with the audit clients. 5. Develop and maintain: Audit methodology and procedures to provide independent assurance over digital initiatives and technological controls. Knowledge of leading practices and activities of existing and new technology in general. 6. Work in conjunction with the Heads of Group Technology and Group Risk to: Better manage business and Technology, Information and Cyber risks. Maintain a good working relationship. Ensure that Group Audit is kept informed of changes in risk management and/or all major new developments. Track the implementation of audit and regulatory recommendations. 7. Work in conjunction with the other Senior Audit Managers and Head, Digital & Technology Audit to provide the most effective working practices for technology audits. 8. Provide agreed management reports to the Head of Digital & TechnologyAudit 9. Build and develop a team of internal auditors to manage and execute audit engagements with the following minimum skills: Excellent project management. Subject matter experts on framework and methodology. Subject matter experts on various applications or operating systems for mainframe, midrange and open systems, and the corresponding IT activities. Ability to identify technology and information security critical issues as well as opportunities. 10. Responsible for staff performance and career management as well as development plans for team members. Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: University Degree in Computer Science or equivalent and possess Certified Information System Auditor (CISA) or equivalent certifications. Minimum of 12 years' experience in technology audits or equivalent in IT (e.g. applications development/ support, infrastructure projects / support). Experience in managing a team and audit engagements. Good knowledge of various banking applications, operating systems, databases, etc. for mainframe, midrange and/or open systems; with working / auditing experience in at least 1 platform. Strong risk-based audit experience with hands-on experience in analytic/visualization tools such as QlikView and ACL. Independent and committed with high level of initiative. Strong analytical and report writing skills. Strong interpersonal and communications skills. High level of integrity, drive and sense of urgency. About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities UOB is on a journey of transforming overall Transaction Banking Architecture in UOB. This is a multi-year program where in we are transforming core cash management platforms which supports payables, receivables, virtual accounts, escrow servicing, domestic and cross border rails, trade, trust and securities services. The role is specifically focused on building payment rails facilitating cash management. You will be a part of the Architecture, Engineering and DevSecOps team.  From technology perspective you will be given opportunity to work on cutting edge technologies including edge computing, real time data services, model run-time platforms, microservices, micro apps, micro front ends as well as embedding finance into ecosystem and partnerships. If you are someone who is passionate about changing the overall financial services landscape then read on. Partner with and acting as a trusted advisor to stakeholders in both business and IT to assist in defining and delivering high quality digital capabilities Work closely with stakeholders to develop practical roadmaps to move the enterprise towards the future state vision, while taking into account business, technical and delivery constraints Work with development teams closely to improve delivery efficiencies Analyze stakeholder requirements, current state architecture, and gaps to create a future state architecture vision for one or more parts of the enterprise with a focus on reduced complexity, cost efficiencies, reuse, convergence, reduced risk and/or improved business capabilities Define and operate the architecture governance process to ensure change initiatives align to the vision and roadmaps Work closely with other Domain Architects across key initiatives and projects to apply architecture principles and standards, and develop reference architectures and design patterns Communicate the principles, standards, vision and roadmaps to stakeholders and proactively addressing any questions / concerns identified Provide thought leadership on architectural or other topics, developing a forward looking view of current and emerging technologies and their impact on the Enterprise Architecture Embed Platform Thinking in everything Job Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent; Formal architecture certification (TOGAF or equivalent) Functional Expertise Required in at least two of the below domains: Payables and Receivables Treasury Management Account Services Liquidity Management Relationship Based Pricing Demonstrate deep domain expertise in: Architecting, designing and developing large scale Digital Platform Solutions Integration with multiple partners for various functions Migrating from legacy applications to an upgraded solutions. building Workflow and Microservices Working knowledge on Clear to Pay Platform or FIS Open Payment Framework is highly desirable or equivalent market leading payments platform Experience in different payment schemes across ASEAN including ISO20022 Experience in working with SWIFT Knowledge in one of the below SpringBoot SpringBatch Apache Camel Apache Kafka Apache Nifi Any API Platform Relational Database Experience (RDBMS) in one or more of the following: Microsoft SQL Server. Oracle. MariaDB. At least 9 years' experience in Enterprise or Solution Architecture in a large, complex, multi-location, multi-national environment Deep experience delivering mission critical, enterprise scale IT solutions in a heterogeneous technology environment Familiarity with best practice methodologies and tools for the entire solution lifecycle from ideation to requirements, design, development, testing, deployment and operations A deep understanding of all domains of Enterprise Architecture, including the business, data, application, infrastructure and security domains Familiarity with one or more formal Architecture frameworks / methodologies (TOGAF, Zachman, BIAN, etc.) Practical experience in data modelling, object modelling, design patterns and Enterprise Architecture tool or other software modelling tools. Practical experience to use business capabilities model Familiarity with heterogeneous technology platforms such as AS400, Unix/Linux, Windows Comfortable in working in an environment which is vendor-intensive Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills to stakeholders at all levels Ability to communicate complex topics in an understandable way using a level of detail and terms appropriate to the situation Capability to think conceptually and identify patterns across seemingly unrelated situations Must be a good team player and able to drive consensus amongst stakeholders with conflicting viewpoints and objectives Possess strong understanding of business strategies and able to translate them into concrete achievable action plans Can deal with difficult conversations effectively Promotes an environment of learning and development. Job_Descriptions: Credit Data Infrastructure Analyst, Group Credit Analytics, Risk Portfolio Management Risk Portfolio Management comprises of a broad range of functions primarily focused on credit portfolio management across banking subsidiaries within OCBC Group. These include: Assessing the risk and opportunities in the Bank's key markets and asset classes in the context of the Bank's risk appetite and against economic, structural and cyclical conditions. Determining the risk and opportunities in the Bank's key markets and asset classes in the context of the Bank's risk appetite and against economic, structural and cyclical conditions. These frameworks are used in the credit underwriting, customer selection, limit setting, early warning and problem recognition, assessment of capital and provision adequacy internally as well as for regulatory compliance. Managing suite of portfolio dashboards and reports to the Board, senior management, functional risk committees and supervisory authorities. Job_Title: Solution Architect (APAC, SOA, Java, Digital Bank) - perm in SG
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Bennie Yeo Principal Recruiter (Program & Change, Banking Tech) View profile & contact Are you exceptional in leading Solution Architecture on a Digital Transformation across APAC in your current Organization? If you have an entrepreneurial and passionate SW Solutioning mindset, this could be the career opportunity for you !! • Onsite Interview Process (Raffles Place) • 50% Travel across APAC (Vietnam, India, Philippines, etc), depending on evolving Covid Travel restrictions As a Solution Architect, it’s your job to ascertain that envisaged solutions become reality. Taking this client-facing role, you are equally comfortable in deep-dive technical workshops and in board-level sales presentations. Having earned your stripes in designing web-based architectures, you have no problem finding the scope in large-scale, complex projects. To the development team, you are the vital mainstay during processes of implementation. To customers and partners, you are the expert liaison with a keen feel for their needs. So besides being a great technician, you are also a considerate companion who delivers remarkable results on a continuous basis. Solution Architect (APAC, SOA, Java, Digital Bank) - perm in SG You will be part of the development team in which you will fulfill a leading role only gained by excellent performance. Talking highly specific technical details as well as discussing general business outcomes, you comfortably translate customer requirements into a distinguished design. You dedicate yourself to security, deployment, performance, caching, sizing, scalability and serviceability. You know our projects are to be delivered according to briefing, time and budget, but you also know our technicians need their space to build the solutions you’ve defined. By creating structure and clear explanations, you provide guidance and oversight to your team. Due to the current situation related to the Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV), we’re leveraging our digital capabilities to ensure we can continue to recruit top talent at HSBC.  As your application progresses, you may be asked to use one of our digital tools to help you through your recruitment journey.  If so, one of our Resourcing colleagues will explain how our video-interviewing technology will be used throughout the recruitment process and will be on hand to answer any questions you might have. Some careers open more doors than others. If you’re looking for a career that will unlock new opportunities, join HSBC and experience the possibilities. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. Sales, Distribution and Business Development plays a vital role in understanding and meeting customer needs by offering the right solutions through the right channels to the right customer segments.  The team is responsible for implementing distribution strategy, driving the delivery of market leading personal banking customer experiences and thereby maximising customer satisfaction. We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Mortgage Sales Manager. Principal Responsibilities Submission of mortgage applications and prompt follow up with customer and internal departments until point of loan inception Conduct proper KYC on customers and business partners (if applicable) to ensure data integrity Timely update of sales numbers to Team Heads for sales projections. Attend to enquiries and leads with relation to mortgage Follow up on servicing issues for existing mortgage customers Requirements A degree with minimum of 2 years of relevant working experience in home loans / mortgage products sales A proven sales track record in home loans / mortgage products A high level of drive to excel and thrive in a sales-oriented environment Outgoing disposition and excellent communication and interpersonal skill To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required. You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC. http://www.hsbc.com/careers HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website. Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.

Job_Title: Sourcing Category Manager, Messaging & Telecom Services
Job_Descriptions: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts. Job Category Finance and Operations Job Details The Sourcing Category Manager, Messaging & Telecom Services is an individual contributor who is responsible for managing the overall business-to-business relationships between Salesforce and the supplier base through day-to-day interactions, metrics management, competitive bid/award/contracting, and supplier business reviews, while achieving cost-effective procurement decisions for the company. This individual will also contribute to the development and execution of a comprehensive global sourcing strategy based on improving SMS relationships with aggregators and mobile network operators. This is a high-growth area with around $400M in annual spend today. Product Management: Partner with internal stakeholders to understand the technical elements and limitations of the SMS business, including understanding of downstream contractual requirements. Using this knowledge combined with market expertise, identify, select, and partner with suppliers to ensure competitive market advantage and quality service. Contribute to category plan and sourcing strategy for SMS globally, driving alignment across several different business units and stakeholders. Analytics and Data Management: Take ownership of price analytics, developing a system to maintain and update price and supplier information. Partner with internal teams to develop robust analytics around usage by country and customer, identifying the most impactful areas for potential sourcing activity. Partner with finance teams to develop business case analysis across different, proposed cost models and quantify the impacts of decisions. Supplier Management: Develop and maintain strategic partner relationships with suppliers. Ensure contract requirements and deliverables are being met through the life of the contracts. Drive continuous improvement initiatives with both internal business owners and suppliers to ensure ongoing cost reduction and service delivery. Internal Stakeholder Collaboration: Influence cross-functional organizations and ensure alignment with a single strategy across these groups. Develop strong relationships with business owners to understand their requirements and limitations and implement these into the category strategy and execution. Advise business owners on new or changed approaches to the category. Collaborate across the organization to ensure business objectives are met, including assisting with executive-level briefings as required. Position Requirements: BA/BS degree, plus 5-10 years experience in sourcing, analytics, or a related field, with a preference for experience in technology and telecom. Experience running data analytics with information from various sources and synthesizing this information into actionable outcomes. Excellent relationship management skills and a proven track record of working collaboratively with suppliers, internal business customers, and senior management. Strong attention to detail. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong interpersonal skills. Team player mentality. While this is an individual contributor role, collaborative team players will thrive in this fast-paced environment where the team relies on individual strengths as well as team strengths for individual and team wins. Ability and comfort to manage in a fast/ambiguous environment. Accommodations If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form. Posting Statement At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org. Salesforce welcomes all.

Job_Title: AVP, GTS-SME Regional Cards Commercialisation Manager IBG3&4 – Institutional Banking Group (IBG)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function Corporate and Investment Banking provides corporate customers with a full range of commercial banking products and services, including cash management services, current accounts, time deposits, trade finance, working capital finance, term loans and foreign exchange. Through our continued commitment, DBS has cultivated long-standing relationships with its customers in the region that are based on account relationship management, service differentiation, product development and rigorous credit standards. Responsibilities Drive business growth by executing the joint GTS-SME business strategy, by rolling out new products and by enabling the client facing sales teams to effectively sell the commercial card payment solutions: Superior Product Proposition: Develop and strengthen the SME Cards product propositions based on a deep understanding of client needs and processes. Commercialize the product solutions by comprehensively addressing the business needs of specific client segments. SME requirements are typically quite simple - accordingly package existing products to cater for ease of use and scalability. For different markets, there may also be a need for localization of these product packages. Sales Enablement: Implement processes to enable RM / Sales teams to have a clear understanding of the product propositions so that they can easily market these solutions to the relevant client segments. Provide training and marketing support to implement go-to-market plans and drive product usage. SME Scale-up: Implement plans to win additional market share and share of wallet. Drive actions to scale up the SME business via new client acquisition and product usage. Leverage data analytics to identify new leads. Use digital marketing and acquisition tools to enable clients to be onboarded quickly and efficiently. Develop and implement plans to gain greater business traction in markets like HK, Taiwan, Indonesia and India. Digital: Drive efforts to maximize the use digital channels for client acquisition, transactions, and ongoing engagements. Focus on providing a positive customer experience with immediate fulfilment wherever possible. Drive greater use of electronic channels like IDEAL and APIs to capture customers' transactional flows and operating business. Business development of ecosystem opportunities including marketplaces, supply chains, integrated ERP platforms or merchant solutions that allow us to capture new business opportunities at scale. Partnerships: Leverage partnerships with other product partners, ERP platforms, card networks, insurance partners and others to help deliver better solutions to our customers. Requirements Bachelors Degree in Business, Banking & Finance or a related discipline Experience in Commercial Card Product Management preferred Proficient in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Powerpoint Preferably relevant experience in SME banking environment Good interpersonal skills Ability to build good rapport both internally and externally and collaborate with partners across all levels of management. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment & communicate accurately and effectively Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

The duties of an Economist are varied and include the analysis of countries and sub-national regions across the Asia-Pacific. The position requires the production of regular high-quality written commentary in a timely manner on a broad range of economic and market trends, while also producing baseline and alternative scenario forecasts under tight deadlines using our global macroeconomic forecast model. The successful candidate will also work with senior staff on larger research and consulting projects and respond to client and media inquiries. Master's degree in Economics or related field and three plus years experience -OR- a Bachelor's degree and five plus years of experience. Experience in macroeconomic analysis, technical writing, and econometric modeling software, and statistical analysis. Must be a motivated, responsible person who can work well with others independently of daily supervision Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work directly with clients are a must. Job_Title: Assistant Vice President, Asia Financial Solutions - Sector Coverage
Job_Descriptions: Asia & Oceania Corporate Banking Department - Sector Coverage Team Overview of Division/Department Our Asia Oceania Corporate Banking - Sector Coverage Team (AOCB-SCT) provides sector driven client engagement and Mizuho regional branch support to strengthen Mizuho's product-related businessess in the Asia Pacific. Company Profile Mizuho Bank, Ltd. is a subsidiary of the Japan-based Mizuho Financial Group, Inc. (listed on the Tokyo Stock Exchange and NYSE) and is one of the largest financial services companies in the world. Mizuho Bank, Ltd. provides financial and strategic solutions for the increasingly diverse and sophisticated needs of its clients with offices located in all the major cities of the world such as Tokyo, New York, London, Hong Kong and Singapore. Job Responsibilities (Internal Corporate Title: Assistant Manager) Your key roles & responsibilities include: Ø Assist sector banker and/or directly provide industry insights and implications mainly to Asia Pacific branches and related HO divisions from in-depth business, financial analysis and strategic discussion with individual companies. Ø Target to meet with relevant parties of Mizuho's customers or prospects to engage in sector driven strategic discussion for business promotion and deal origination. Ø Provide timely industry information and market intelligence by conducting industry portfolio analysis, monitoring, while keeping in touch with industry relevant parties, etc. Ø Support senior sector banker and/or directly support branches and related HO divisions to develop business strategy and/or marketing plan to capture business opportunities. Ø Support senior sector banker and/or directly originate deals by collaborating with other professionals including other SCT, AOCB members, other financial products members and analysts in other regions. Ø Help prepare and/or directly provide sector outlook, forecasts, and analysis on selected industries when requested, and hold industry teach-in or market briefing when appropriate. Ø Help liaise with branches/offices in Asia and Head Office for credit approval related issues when required. Ø Develop new research approaches in order to establish product promotion type of research practice in line with CFAS initiatives. Job Requirements What you should have: At least 3 years of relevant corporate finance analytical experience, having obtained this preferably from an accounting firm or investment bank. Other relevant experiences, such as those obtained from a corporate bank, rating agency, or finance department role in a large corporate or multi-national company will also be considered. Must be comfortable in a largely analytical role, but with the ability to convert the analysis into business ideas / sound advice that would appeal to our corporate clients. Strong knowledge of business portfolio analysis, valuation of companies, and M&A modeling is critical to the role. Must be comfortable and confident in presenting own analysis/ideas to senior management executives of our corporate clients (CFO, Group Treasurer). In addition, the candidate must be flexible to travel to meet corporate clients; The candidate must be a strong team player, with willingness to provide guidance to more junior members of the team; A Bachelor's Degree in Commerce or Finance or related discipline is a minimum requirement for applicants, while MBA or Post-Graduate qualifications in Finance or CFA accreditation would be highly desirable. Knowledge of the power, utilities, renewables and infrastructure sectors is a plus. Join Mizuho Bank, Ltd., in Singapore, and be part of our team, passionate to build the future together. "One MIZUHO: Building the future with you"

Job_Title: VP, Red Team, Group Information Security
Job_Descriptions: VP, Red Team, Group Information Security VP, Red Team, Group Information Security Posting Date: 17-Jan-2022 Location: Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities This is an excellent opportunity for a Red Teamer or an experienced Penetration Tester looking to advance their skills, to participate in a forward looking Red Team at a prominent regional bank. The successful Red Team member will help to build and deliver red team operations, purple teaming exercises, pentests of the latest security products and contribute actively in the bank's efforts in adopting and maintaining an enterprise-wide view of threat-driven risks, with the goal of working with various stakeholders in the enterprise to manage these risks. The candidate will need to have proven track record in advanced network, system and application exploitation and will be required to work independently or as part of the red team to execute threat simulations. Plan and execute red team operations and campaigns across the spectrum of people, processes and technologies. Develop techniques from the Mitre ATT&CK framework and perform purple teaming exercises working closely with the SOC team to enhance detection and prevention capabilities. Support the development of red teaming methods, operations and simulations within and across the enterprise to include cyber security, personnel security, operations security, facilities security, and third party vendors/service providers. Provide cybersecurity technical testing services, including network, system or application penetration test and vulnerability assessment through in-depth technical analysis and exploitation of vulnerabilities. Provide regular threat/risk updates, presenting findings and learnings from cyber-attacks, red team operations, and cyber-attack simulations within a context of overall risk to the enterprise. Work closely with existing technology infrastructure, business application and security teams, both to receive input and to provide practical and actionable threat intelligence. Evaluate, build and support a set of open-source and commercial security tools. Plan and manage third party red teaming and penetration tests. Job Requirements Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering or related discipline. OSCP and/or CREST CRT certified. Advanced certifications such as OSCE, OSEP, CRTE, OSEE, GXPN, CREST CCT and CCSAS would be an advantage. At least 8 years of IT experience, in which over 5 years are in the domain of technical security testing, preferably in a banking environment. Excellent infrastructure and web penetration testing skills. Ability to circumvent incident detection processes when conducting red team operations. Ability to build custom tools and exploits using one or more of the following: powershell, python or C#. Knowledge of the latest Cybersecurity tools and vulnerabilities. Experience in utilizing the Mitre ATT&CK framework would be an advantage. Reverse engineering and exploit development experience would be an advantage. Red teaming and purple teaming experience would be an advantage, but not a requirement. Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills. Ability to collaborate and share knowledge within a fast-moving environment. Ability to work effectively with a variety of stakeholders interests within the enterprise. Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Title: AVP, Policy (AML/CFT), Group Financial Crime Compliance - (210002JH)
Job_Descriptions: OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world’s most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody’s. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World’s Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Legal and Regulatory Compliance (GLRC) supports the Bank in all legal, regulatory and compliance matters. The division ensures that the Bank's businesses comply with policies, procedures and relevant laws, rules and regulations issued by Monetary Authority of Singapore and other local regulators. Apart from being a legal advisor on litigation, trademark filings and other legality issues where relevant, GLRC plays an important role as undertakers of the bank-wide regulatory compliance and anti-money laundering initiatives. This includes developing policies and procedures to manage and mitigate risks relating to money laundering and financing of terrorism, as well as monitoring, detection and combating of money laundering and financial crime activities. Key Responsibilities: Assist the Head Policy (AML/CFT) in the execution and implementation of Policy (AML/CFT) (“Policy”) work within GLRC AML. The scope of the Policy function includes AML/CFT and related Policies/Procedures, AML/CFT Projects and Products, Industry Projects, and supporting audits and regulatory inspections management. Understand the various policy and regulatory requirements in countries where OCBC operates and adopt requirements or practices that are robust to support the Group’s AML/CFT framework and program Responsible for Group AML/CFT policies and procedure creation, maintenance, and implementation. Ensuring that the Group AML/CFT policies and procedures are maintained, updated, and implemented timely. Conduct exercises required under the Group AML/CFT program for the Group (such as entity risk assessment, benchmark against regulations, etc). Assist with assessing ML/TF risks in new product approvals. Assist with preparing and updating compliance training materials and/or conduct trainings on AML/CFT areas. Prepare the submission of metrics for Senior Management Reporting. This also includes periodically refreshing and enhancing the reporting formats, KPIs, metrics, etc. Any other duties deem necessary by the Head of Policy (AML/CFT). Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: A university degree with at least 5 years’ experience in compliance and anti-money laundering/counter terrorism financing compliance (“AML”) with established financial institutions. Broad knowledge of business, operations and the AML/CFT regulatory framework in which bank groups operate. Strong problem solving and analytical skills. Strong communication (including written) and interpersonal skills. Ability to influence and work with multiple stakeholders across the business. At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Assistant Vice President / Vice President, Reconciliations & Operational Client Services (ROCS) Python Software Engineer, Global Markets Operations Technology, Global Markets Technology
Job_Descriptions: Job Description: Your background You are a very strong Python developer with extensive experience building middle-tier services You are a self-starter and eager learner. You are a hands-on developer with work experiences in any of the following languages such as Java, C# or .NET. You have a good understanding of common algorithms and data structures. You have strong problem-solving and analytics skills. You have a good understanding of SDLC and application of Agile Methodologies including but not limited to automated testing (such as Test-Driven Development), Code Review, Continuous Integration and Version Control Systems. Ideally, you have an education in computer science (or relevant subjects). What you can expect The Insight team manages a dynamic rules engine that provides solutions to produce regulatory reports for the Firms regulators within the Global Markets domain.  We have a team of strong developers who are able to leverage off each other’s expertise and technical skills. We would be able to offer a highly technical track to developers who would like to pursue career in the technical domain within Investment Banking. What you will do You would spend 80% of time in hands-on programming. You would be responsible for developing, enhancing, modifying and/or maintaining applications in the Global Markets environment. You would collaborating with global teams to design and build new functionality on Quartz and other shared platforms. You would be interacting directly with end users, compliance and senior stakeholders to capture requirements without having to rely on business analysts or project managers. You would be managing a high level of risk with in-depth capital markets product knowledge. You would provide level 3 production support for applications. About Bank of America Our purpose as a firm is to make financial lives better, through the power of every connection. Across the world, we partner with leading corporate and institutional investors through our offices in more than 35 countries. In the U.S. alone, we serve almost all of the Fortune 500 companies and approximately 67 million consumer and small-business clients. We provide a full suite of financial products and services, from banking and investments to asset and risk management. We cover a broad range of asset classes, making us a global leader in corporate and investment banking, sales and trading. Connecting Asia Pacific to the world Our Asia Pacific team is spread across 19 cities in 12 markets. We are focused on connecting Asia to the world and the world to Asia, using our global expertise to ensure success is shared between us, our clients and our communities. Our regional footprint covers 12 currencies, more than a dozen languages and five time zones, placing us firmly among the region’s leading financial services companies.

Job_Title: Assistant Vice President / Vice President, Application Software Engineer, Global Markets Operations Technology, Global Markets Technology
Job_Descriptions: Job Description: Your background You can communicate in Mandarin as the projects will require interacting with China base Mandarin speaking users. You have strong coding skills with work experiences in any of the following programming languages such as Python, Java, C# or .NET. You are proficient in Database concepts – MS SQL/Sybase/Oracle. You have a strong understanding of Agile , with an emphasis on test driven development & continuous integration You are broadly skilled who can pick up new technologies and concepts and apply them to your day to day work. You should have an understanding of tools like Gradle, Jenkins, Git and Ansible You can multi-task & work independently under tight timelines & challenging environment You can provide structured reporting of the project progress and various other metrics to senior management You are a good team player with confidence as you will need to mentor junior members as well as receive guidance from senior team members. You are a good communicator to fellow developers, management and business stakeholders. You can work proactively with multiple stakeholders across the organization. What you can expect We are a high performing development team working to build and deliver critical back-office solutions by enhancing the bank’s in-house applications for both Global Markets and Banking Business. In a typical day you could expect to analyze, design and code software solutions, review code, attend agile ceremonies, refine requirements with stakeholders and liaise with other teams. You will partner with business, technology, and operations; working closely with SMEs in our regional branches (Mainland China, Japan, Taiwan etc.) to deliver projects involving business enablement, regulatory, risk, and efficiency initiatives. You will have the opportunity to work on a large multi-tier applications which are deployed and operate in multiple locations. You will be part of a cross functional scrum teams working closely with stakeholders and project managers distributed regionally. What you will do Product Development – You would spend 70% of the time in hands-on programming to enhance new features & functionality in existing platforms. Should be able evolve the code base & enhance the system performance. Regional Dev Teams – Work with onshore and offshore regional development teams to implement requirements. Test your Own Code – Write and test your code by provide the automated test coverage. Accountability - Expected to have strong accountability & ownership to deliver highest quality of work. Application Governance : Bank’s application management activities to ensure we remain in compliance with Enterprise Governance. Communication - Communicate with the users for the immediate/short/long term solutions. Job Summary Normally receives little instruction on routine work, general instructions on new assignments. Conducts surveys to ascertain the locations of natural features and human-made structures on the earth's surface, underground, and underwater, using electronic distance-measuring equipment and other surveying instruments. Operates and manages land-information computer systems, performs tasks such as storing data, making inquiries, and producing plots and reports. Reviews information from survey teams regarding measurement of distances, directions, angles between points and elevation of points, lines, and contours on, above, and below the earth’s surface. Researches legal records, looks for evidence of previous boundaries, and analyzes the data to determine the location of boundary lines. Records the results of surveys, verifies the accuracy of data, and prepares plots, maps, and reports. An experienced professional with full understanding of area of specialization. Works on problems of diverse scope. Minimum Requirements - Preferred Qualifications - What We Offer We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed. You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients. We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on, the teams and committees you join and our business. We offer competitive pay and benefits, well-being programs to support you and your family, and the development resources you need to advance your career. When you join us, you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners, designers, engineers, scientists, consultants, program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours. Job Category Quantity Surveying Business Line PCC Business Group Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS) Country Singapore Position Status Full Time Requisition/Vacancy No. 259142BR Virtual: No Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

Properties - Senior Properties Executive (Lease) Job Description The successful candidate will support Manager Properties (Lease) in the management of the Organisation’s (including subsidiaries) real-estate portfolio of owned and leased properties worldwide. Key Responsibilities include: • World-wide Lease Administration. • To work on lease-outs of SIA-owned properties. • To handle property tax matters for local or overseas properties. • To provide notional rental rate for SIA-owned properties. • Management of Owned Properties Worldwide. • To refresh SIA-owned residential properties. • To verify insurance values (CIP) submitted by overseas stations for company owned and leased properties. • Advisory and Support Services to Business Units. • To key in and verify the information of new/ renewals of local and overseas leases to ensure compliance with latest IFRS16 accounting standards for leases. • Source and secure deals on property matters for SIA (leasing, purchasing, sale and development of properties for residential, commercial or industrial use) and ensuring that the price and terms obtained are fair and reflective of prevailing market conditions. • Ensure that all local and overseas leases for SIA are well administered. This is especially critical for premises used for SIA’s operations, where any hitches in the premises’ lease may have far-reaching implications on the airlines’ operations, which in turn would affect profitability, image and service level of the Group. • Conduct feasibility studies and market research, thorough investigations on macro (political, economic, tax and legal implications, etc) and micro issues (location, image, operational requirements, etc), and present the findings and recommendations to Senior Management for making policy decisions on property matters. • Provide an advisory role/support to overseas and local operations on all real estates matters. Where there are complications on leases/real estate matters, eg. frustration of contract, non-compliance of lease terms by either landlords or tenants, the jobholder is expected to assist and/or take-over the negotiation to resolve the issues. Requirements • Preferably to possess a Bachelor’s degree in Real Estate • Relevant working experience in the real estate industry. • Exposure in the regional real estate market is an advantage for the jobholder. • Knowledge of valuation principles and cash flow modelling are essential. • Ability to communicate and write well. • Good aptitude for figures, analytical and resourcefulness • Good negotiation skills • Customer-oriented and service-minded. Degree

Job_Title: Information Technology - Scrum Master (Aircraft Engineering & Supply Chain)
Job_Descriptions: Job Description The successful candidate will be part of a dynamic and fast paced environment that is responsible for digitalizing key business processes in supply chain and aircraft maintenance - covering Aircraft Engineering, Logistics and Procurement business units. The candidate will work on building and managing IT solutions across a spectrum of technologies – from mission critical systems to mobile apps, predictive maintenance, supply chain planning & optimisation - founded on an end-to-end process design, a data-driven, digital mindset and delivered using Agile Methodologies. The successful candidate will join the Operations & Enterprise (Engineering) department in SIA Information Technology Division. Key Responsibilities include: Engage business stakeholders to understand their requirements. Design IT solutions that meet business objectives, digitalize key operational processes and drive digital ops. Build and manage IT solutions to transform airline operations in line with the Ops Digital Roadmap. Work with technology, business units and relevant functional managers to ensure that IT solutions are aligned to the digital Enterprise Architecture and IT Application roadmap. Manage the overall delivery of the product backlog based on Agile methodology. Track and improve product metrics and report to BU steering committees. Ensure prompt resolution of IT issues and minimize impact to airline operations. Monitor the technology roadmap for periodic upgrades and work with respective business users to implement changes required. Track and identify innovative applications and technologies for potential adoption by business. Any relevant ad-hoc duties. This is an individual contributor role. Requirements Degree in Information Technology or related fields. Must be a Certified Scrum Master. Minimum 5 years of relevant experience with proven track record in IT project delivery based on Agile methodologies. Proven track record in designing complex, mission critical applications that meet or exceed operational metrics for scalability, security, compliance, performance and quality is required. Significant experience in the following areas is preferred: - Large scale J2EE systems, including various integration technologies, especially integrations with SAP MM / PM. - Mobilizing enterprise applications using iOS. - Cloud Technologies and Deployment. Proven problem-solving, communication and troubleshooting skills. Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively as part of a highly skilled team.

Job_Title: VP, Financial Information Management (Change Management-Expense Allocation System), Group Finance
Job_Descriptions: VP, Financial Information Management (Change Management-Expense Allocation System), Group Finance VP, Financial Information Management (Change Management-Expense Allocation System), Group Finance Posting Date: 18-Jan-2022 Location: Raffles Place, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Finance and Corporate Services function manages the financial and administrative needs of the Group to help achieve its business goals. Group Finance We support enhanced decision-making to achieve optimal and sustainable financial outcomes for our shareholders. We are responsible for providing insights into the performance of the Group through financial, regulatory and performance reporting of the Group. Job Responsibilities We are looking for a suitably qualified candidate to join the Finance Information Management - Change Management Team within Group Finance. You will support the Group's Performance Management Engine - Expense Allocation (PME- EA) system. Your specific responsibilities include: Analyse and support planning of the User Acceptance Tests (UAT) for PME - EA -related change requests and projects Perform UAT preparation and execution tasks, including configuration / parameter of the PME - EA software to support the testing cycles Conduct functional validation of system changes, including data transformation, calculations of various expense allocation type components and generation of the reports Support financial verification of Group-level results Working closely with stakeholders & IT counterpart Job Requirements Degree in Finance/Banking related discipline with 5-8 years analytics experience Knowledge of banking Products, including Cards, Loans, Overdrafts, Trade Finance and Treasury instruments Strong understanding in Financial Reporting, Expense Allocation & GL Proficient in SQL Query, MS Excel functions, Power point, Data Analytic Tools (eg: OBIEE, Qlik, Power BI) is a must Experience in conducting UAT, Defect Management and documenting test scripts, results and findings is a must Experience in Python or R is a plus Exposure to documents such as Business Requirements, Functional Specifications, Data Mappings Team player, meticulous and able to work independently possess good communication skills Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Title: Executive/ Senior Executive/ Assistant Manager HR Talent Acquisition & Staffing
Job_Descriptions: Executive/ Senior Executive/ Assistant Manager HR Talent Acquisition & Staffing Job Description The successful candidate will join our Talent Acquisition & Staffing team in SIA Human Resources Division, whose mission is to develop and implement effective talent acquisition strategies and hiring plans to attract best talents for the organisation. Key responsibilities include: - Develop and execute recruitment and staffing plans, by working with Business Units for the planning and fulfilment of their recruitment and staffing needs - Research and recommend new sources for active and passive candidate recruitment - Review of processes to streamline, digitalise while ensuring/ improving positive candidate experience. Use metrics to create hiring dashboard and identify areas of improvement (e.g. time-to-hire and cost-per-hire). - Engagement with educational institutions, organisations for talent pipeline. This includes working with them to participate in career fairs, internships, events etc. Requirements - Bachelor’s degree in business administration, human resources or relevant field, with ideally more than 4 years of experience in a talent acquisition role. - Good knowledge of local employment regulations. - Excellent writing, communication and stakeholder management skills. - Experience in full-cycle recruiting, sourcing and employment branding, with understanding of candidate selection methods and techniques. - Proficient in the use of social media and job boards. - Working knowledge of Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and databases, especially in Success Factor.

Job Description Provide tax advice on tax-efficient outbound investment structures, including structures for the setting up of real estate funds, acquisitions of companies or properties located overseas e.g. China, US, UK, Europe, Japan, Australia Advise on cross-border tax issues, e.g. profit repatriation strategies, withholding taxes, transfer pricing, etc Review/perform tax due diligence on acquisitions of properties/companies Work with legal and financial and tax advisors on M&A deals, acquisitions, and divestments of investments Keep up to date with changes in international tax rules and apprise management of any implications on corporate tax position Review transfer pricing documentation, cost allocation methodology and analysis Be responsible for tax compliance reviews and dispute management Engage government bodies and tax authorities for favourable tax positions as well as objections to tax assessments including litigations where applicable Provide knowledge guidance to members of the team Undertake adhoc projects as and when assigned Requirements At least 10 years of relevant experience gained in a Big 4 accounting firm or a large organization with in-house tax function Exposure to the real estate and funds management sectors Degree in Accountancy or ACCA / CPA qualification or equivalent Accreditation with the Singapore Chartered Tax Professionals (SCTP) Ability to work independently and under pressure in a fast-paced and dynamic environment A resourceful, analytical, and self-motivated mindset Strong adaptability and technical skills Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work with all levels of staff Proficiency in written and spoken English and Chinese (able to review agreements in Chinese) due to Chinese business requirements Location : Singapore If the above speaks to you, we'd love to hear from you. Job Description The successful candidate will join the Middle Office & Projects / Treasury department in SIA Finance Division. You will perform critical Treasury Middle Office operations, including cash management, e-banking, reporting and other duties as assigned. Key Responsibilities include: Ensure the timely and accurate accounting of Treasury trades Perform electronic banking administration duties, including ensuring proper system access management for both local and overseas offices and troubleshooting with stakeholders to resolve issues Ensure proper accounting and custodianship for receipts of funds/cash Prepare reports for control and reporting purposes Participate in user acceptance testing activities for system enhancements Support the Treasury team as relevant for accounting, reporting and operational duties Requirements Possess a diploma in Accounting, Business Administration or Finance Previous work experience in a Treasury or Finance-related role will be advantageous Well-organised, meticulous, independent and able to perform well under pressure Good interpersonal skills, able to work well in a team, and able to communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders Self-starter and result-oriented with strong numerical, analytical and problem-solving skills Proficient in Microsoft Office Knowledge of SAP will be advantageous

Job Description The successful candidate will join the Passenger Sales Accounting Department in SIA Finance Division. Key Responsibilities include: Reconciliation of various Passenger Sales’ suspense accounts and clearance of system pending errors, as part of internal controls to identify sales anomalies and erroneous sales/ticketing practices. Liaise and resolve with stations on such anomalies noted Ensure accuracy of the sales accounting entries generated by International Passenger Revenue Accounting system Address queries from stations as well as outsourced vendor to resolve issues relating to Pax Sales' operational matters Monitor document submission from stations and ensure timely and complete dispatch to outsourced vendor. Highlight and follow up with stations on any delay/issues with the document submission process Ensure that all the interline billing relating to reissue transactions are done promptly and accurately Monitor and manage the passenger sales related work done by outsourced vendor to ensure that the KPI targets are met Provide guidance to the outsourced vendor in relation to the reconciliation and clearance of Passenger Sales’ suspense accounts Conduct Quality Control Check on the passenger sales related work done by outsourced vendor to ensure that it has been processed accurately and promptly Assist in the timely completion of the Control Self-Assessment Complete any other duties assigned to meet team objectives Requirements Possesses a Diploma in Accounting, Business Administration or Finance; Entry level candidates are welcome to apply Able to work independently, collaboratively and under tight deadlines Adaptable to changes and a problem solver Good inter-personal skills and communication skills Proficient in Microsoft Office, knowledge of SAP will be advantageous

In a world of disruption and increasingly complex business challenges, our professionals bring truth into focus with the Kroll Lens. Our sharp analytical skills, paired with the latest technology, allow us to give our clients clarity—not just answers—in all areas of business. We embrace diverse backgrounds and global perspectives, and we cultivate diversity by respecting, including, and valuing one another. As part of One team, One Kroll, you’ll contribute to a supportive and collaborative work environment that empowers you to excel. Kroll leadership relies heavily on the knowledge and expertise of the Talent Acquisition Team, looking to those professionals to recruit and assist in selection of the firm's employees.  As part of a global established team, you will be responsible for recruiting university students across the broader APAC region. We are looking for someone who enjoys being busy, has plenty of initiative, is collaborative, and relishes a challenge. At Kroll, your work will help deliver clarity to our clients’ most complex governance, risk, and transparency challenges. Apply now to join One team, One Kroll. Responsibilities Responsible for managing the recruitment lifecycle ensuring a great candidate experience Building and executing attraction plans to recruit intern and entry level hires Cultivating and maintaining relationships with Career Services at target universities Organizing and attending university events virtually and on campus, including university fairs, workshops, case studies and presentations Building strong relationships with target universities and societies to attract diverse candidates in line with the firm’s objectives to build a diverse and inclusive workforce Managing assessment centres and working with the internal scheduling team ensuring adequate resources are deployed to assess and select top talent Track candidate records in firm’s applicant tracking system Conduct initial interviews, manage the video interview process, sell the organization, and present candidate qualifications to hiring managers for review Work with hiring managers and the Human Capital team to formulate offer components, present offers to candidates and ensure a high percentage of offer acceptances Manage and maintain key client relationships, advising clients on strategic hiring decisions Work towards ensuring that all talent acquisition and staffing metrics are met, as well as other team goals Requirements: Minimum 2 years’ experience in recruiting/ talent acquisition; previous university recruiting experience is required Bachelor’s degree in business (or similar discipline) is required Strong problem solver with exceptional ability to multitask, handle ambiguity and work in a fast-paced environment. Ability to think globally and be sensitive to international recruiting practices Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with experience in managing events A collaborative communicator, who can build genuine relationships with stakeholders and candidates at all levels Strong presentation and analytic skills The ideal candidate will have prior experience in the financial services or professional services industries (consulting or public accounting preferred) Experienced in the use of ATS software is necessary (Ideally Oracle Recruiting Cloud) In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com. Kroll is committed to equal opportunity and diversity, and recruits people based on merit.

The Associate is expected to be able to perform all methods of research, including desktop research, interviews and field investigation. The Associate is expected to maintain the highest level of integrity in conducting research. The role seeks a self-starter, motivated personality, excited to learn about different industries & companies in Southeast Asia, and bilingual in Bahasa Indonesia and English languages. At Kroll, your work will help deliver clarity to our clients’ most complex governance, risk, and transparency challenges. Apply now to join One team, One Kroll. RESPONSIBILITIES: The Associate will be responsible for producing and supporting the research and investigative work that forms the basis of Kroll’s work for its clients. Specifically: Source information from primary & secondary sources including databases, internet and public domain Be creative in developing traditional and non-traditional sources of information, especially in areas where public information is limited Verify the credibility of the information and sources Field investigation Analyse the information, draw implications for clients Prepare high quality written and oral reports in English REQUIREMENTS: Strong academic background, preferably a degree in one of these fields from a top university – Business Studies, Economics, Journalism, International Relations, Political Science, or Security Studies Commercial experience, preferably gained in a research-intensive environment Significant experience of living and working in Southeast Asian (ideally one or more of Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Vietnam or Thailand) to understand local nuances Aware of and understands relevant regulations relating to confidentiality and data protection Able to understand business, economic and political drivers Discreet and able to handle sensitive information in confidence Resourceful and analytical with good common sense and sound business acumen Bilingual in Bahasa Indonesia and English languages as research and investigations would be conducted in Bahasa Indonesia Good computer skills including word processing and Excel Experience in writing effective reports and/or articles Excellent written and verbal communication skills that help represent diverse communities Experience working with diverse teams In order to be considered for a position, you must formally apply via careers.kroll.com.
