Job_Title: Security Strategy and Digital Solution consultant (Azure)
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Syeulgi Choi Talent Advisor View profile & contact Security strategy and digital solution consultant who has strong hands-on experiences in designing and/or reviewing security architecture and digital solution for various inter-connected application and infrastructures, especially in the cloud environment. This position is responsible for providing consultation, professional advice, security architecture and strategic thinking for the digital solutions and transformation across technology to ensure secure solutions for business growth. Information Security Strategy Define, Design and Review security architecture and strategic proposal for various security-driven initiatives or business-driven initiatives for the cloud environment to support digital transformation Identify strategic opportunities for Technology and Business through a strong understanding of business model, business requirements, customer needs and emerging modern technologies Build up strong and in-depth and proactive relationship at all levels across technology functions as well as line of business Deep knowledge of security design and architecture, authentication and authorization flow of the applications, security best practices and organization's IT security technology policy & procedure, session management, token management, cryptographic algorithm, zero trust and information/data protection and so on. Provide feasible application security architecture recommendations or guidance based on proposed application changes either it is initiated by application development team or business users. Work closely with application development team to proactively stay on top of latest secure application architecture design to deliver thorough security recommendation aligned with organization's IT security technology policy & procedure. Facilitate challenging application security architecture conversations and provide acceptable solutions where IT standards are contradicting with business demands to achieve acceptable business solutions without sacrificing security and compliance aspects. Digital Solution Identify, propose and initiate digital solution improvements for technology, ensuring that they have a measurable effect on security enhancement and process effectiveness, with associated benefits to the business Lead and engage with vendors to understand third-party software life cycles and upgrade paths to input into digital solution roadmap recommendations for Security Be responsible for driving and fostering a culture where developers take responsibility for CI/CD processes and success of ongoing support, maintenance, and evolution of software solutions following DevSecOps processes Understand company’s digital roadmap and collaborate effectively with colleagues across IT including but not limited to Run and Change teams and business Lead and work closely with Digital Technology team to propose and work out solution development projects for Web-based, Mobile and other software solutions in the digital world Work closely with infrastructure operation team to proactively stay on top of latest secure infrastructure architecture design to deliver thorough security recommendation aligned with organization's IT security technology policy & procedure. Facilitate challenging infrastructure security architecture conversations and provide acceptable solutions where IT standards are contradicting with business demands to achieve acceptable business solutions without sacrificing security and compliance aspects. Specialized Information Security Domains The role may be called upon to lead or be involved in reviewing or standardizing the information security architecture across key digital solutions especially on cloud security, application security and data security. Assist in security review and coordination for Technology division application development teams, where applicable Although this is an individual contributor role, the candidate should also expect to perform the role of a specialist mentor to the junior members of the staff within the team and be able to work with all levels Job Requirements University degree in one of the following or related disciplines (Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Security, Information Systems) Minimum 7 years of experiences (12 years for Senior role) of security architecture, strategy or security consultant, digital solutioning. Hands-on experiences of designing and/or reviewing application security or infrastructure security and few years working experience as security consulting Working experiences in insurance / banking / consulting industry is preferred Certifications related to security architecture or Cloud Security is preferable, such as CCSP, Azure DevOps certification, Azure Solutions Architect certification, etc Good communication and interpersonal skills Good team player with a high integrity, proactive mindset, and strong ownership Preferably a holder of one or more of the following information security and audit qualifications: CISSP, CISA, CRISC, CCSP Build a career with us as we help our customers and the community live healthier, longer, better lives. You must provide all requested information, including Personal Data, to be considered for this career opportunity. Failure to provide such information may influence the processing and outcome of your application. You are responsible for ensuring that the information you submit is accurate and up-to-date.

The Senior Test Analyst is responsible for managing the day-to-day activities in the testing cycle (Waterfall and Agile). The person will be responsible for preparation of Test Scenarios, Test case design, Requirement Traceability Matrix, Test Data and Execution & raising defects across multiple projects. He/she is expected to deliver high-quality test results in a timely manner by ensuring that functional and non-functional requirements are tested and included in test case design. The role exercises independent judgment to understand testing requirements and understand the end-to-end flows. This role will work directly with Scrum Masters / Project Managers, Development, Business Analysts, Vendor teams, Application Support, and will interact directly with end users during UAT phase. Duties Understand the testing effort by analyzing the requirements of project. Work with users, project managers, development and business analyst teams to ensure efficiency of system integration test cycles and propose improvements required if defects are found. This includes the technical support of all testing cycles (System Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing) for both Technology Change the Bank and Run the Bank projects, ensuring all deliverables are aligned with technology development governance, championing and utilising Quality Assurance procedures. Arrange the Hardware and software requirement for the Test Setup. Creating, maintaining, and executing test plans, test cases and requirement traceability matrix against the requirements for our software platforms. Drive execution of manual and automated testing to ensure the timely delivery of different testing milestones. Promote knowledge of manual / automation testing and defect tracking tools to help in proper tool selection and set-up. Resolve testing problems by modifying testing methods during tests, conferring with management to revise test objectives and standards. Maintain testing database by developing defect tracking and regression testing information requirements, designing information system to capture test outcomes. Ensure content and structure of all Testing documents / artifacts is documented and maintained as per standards defined by the organization. Track and prepare the report of testing activities like test testing results, test case coverage, required resources, defects discovered and their status, performance baselines etc. Report test outcomes by collecting, analyzing, interpreting, summarizing, and displaying data; recommend software changes when required. Work in Agile squads closely with Business Analysts, Developers and Product owners. Qualifications Work Experience Requirements Preferably degree-educated in Technology or Business disciplines. At least 6 years of Testing with 4 years of knowledge in T24 / Triple A Plus and Wealth Management testing Strong Functional Knowledge with Private Banking products, financial instruments, and Temenos T24 including previous implementation of Securities, Corporate actions, Treasury and Derivatives products Strong personal aptitudes, reliable, flexible, adaptable and able to propose “out of the box” solutions to stakeholder Hands on experience in Automation tools (Validata, TOSCA, Selenium, etc. Excellent communication skills, ability to manage communication with business and technology stakeholders. Good database testing knowledge Demonstrated initiative and commitment to ongoing process improvement Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong trouble-shooting and problem-solving skills and ability to adapt to changing priorities. Experience / Knowledge on the Agile methodology Good to have Business Analysis experience in T24

Job Summary & Responsibilities OUR IMPACT Listed Clearing is a technology intensive business that aims to provide our clients with all the tools and services to run their business. In Listed clearing technology team, we regularly consider new technology products available in the market or in the firm to meet our clients’ needs and high trading volumes. As a result, we are constantly expanding our platform to offer clients more products, creating opportunities for people in the group to gain experience in a variety of different technologies. Our team develops products to streamline the post-trade lifecycle. We work with operations to improve Straight Through Processing (STP) by eliminating manual processes that occur after the trade is made. Steps in post-trade processing include validation, enrichment, clearing, matching, book keeping, commission & fee calculation and confirmation. YOUR IMPACT The Listed Clearing team creates and enhances a suite of applications used to clear, process and report global listed and over-the-counter derivatives traded by Hedge Funds, Institutional investors, and internal firm trading desks. This includes both external connectivity to global clearing houses and exchanges, and internal trade matching, lifecycle management, and billing/reporting. The team works closely with our business and operations counterparts on product specifications and workflows. This gives team members the opportunity to learn about the wide variety of asset classes our clients trade, as well as having a direct impact on business efficiency in a technology-intensive business in which Goldman Sachs is a market leader. Client demands and high trading volumes put a constant pressure on us to look at new technology products available in the market place or in the firm. As a result, listed clearing is constantly expanding its platform to offer clients more products, creating opportunities for people in the group to gain exposure to the latest technologies. This will be a fantastic learning opportunity to work with different technologies applied at scale, get exposure to the business and operations, innovate and make a real impact the bottom line. We’re looking for self-motivated people, driven to learn about technology and the business it supports, who voice their opinions, and drive the team forward through innovation and new ideas. JOB SUMMARY & RESPONSIBILITIES • A wide variety of projects are active in the Listed Clearing space and we have a long pipeline of proposed business solutions • The primary role of the candidate is to design, develop, and support one or more components of the distributed Listed Derivatives Clearing System • The candidate is expected to participate in the entire software development life cycle from definition of requirements through deployment and support • The successful candidate will work closely with IT peers and Operations professionals to define behavior, services, and interfaces for the tools under development • The candidate is expected to work closely with colleagues and users in other regions • On occasion, the candidate is expected to lead technical discussions with the global team members BASIC QUALIFICATIONS • 5+ years IBM iSeries programming • Expertise with the Sungard GMI software package required • Experience with iSeries Java implementation a plus • Experience providing high quality production support to a demanding user base • Experience with requirement gathering from interactions with end-users • Experience with full project life cycle • Solid communication and presentation skills • Demonstrate solid ability to multi-task (2-3 simultaneous projects) • Must be a self-starter PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS • GMI software design and implementation experience essential • iSeries SQL required • Experience with MQ messaging highly desirable • Familiarity with build/deployment tool - Turnover • Experience with CDC DataMirror replication a plus • RPG IV design/development • Java programming a plus

What's the story? Nium is a next-generation financial services platform  that enables companies around the world to unlock new revenue opportunities and improve cash flow economics Nium is a leader in its geographical and payment service breadth, owning licenses in the world's largest and fastest-growing economies. Our modular platform allows banks, payment providers, travel companies, and other businesses to collect and disburse funds in local currencies to over 100 countries, plus issue physical and virtual cards globally. Our proprietary set of APIs embeds financial services and can bring to life multiple B2B and B2C use cases in a matter of weeks. Nium is part of CB Insights Fintech 250, which highlights the most promising Fintech companies globally. Today, Nium serves over 130 million customers and enables platforms to provide access to financial services to over 3 billion people across the world. Where do you come into the picture? Risk Management forms the backbone of NIUM's business : it not only represents the financial interest of the company but also its clients providing the optimal balance between risk mitigation, customer experience and profitable business growth. The Director of Risk Management is responsible for developing and managing the end-to-end framework governing fraud and financial risk across all business jurisdictions where NIUM operates. Working in a fast-paced environment, you will be responsible for shaping strategies, policies, and processes for NIUM products and services. Reporting to the Global Head of Fraud Risk management, the role holder will partner closely with colleagues in other functions such as Fraud Operations, Compliance, Product, Sales, Marketing, Finance, Servicing, Legal, and Technology to ensure that all related risks are maintained within the company's risk appetite. You will also be expected to regularly represent the company and the risk management function to external parties such as NIUM clients, business partners, regulators, and industry peers. You will ensure business activities are in line with our company policies and financial exposure is properly assessed and controlled within acceptable limits. You will also conduct regular audits to identify potential threats, develop plans to prevent and mitigate problems and produce relevant reports to senior management. In this role, you should be highly perceptive and methodical with the ability to communicate effectively, presenting and articulating your plans and decisions in the most convincing way. What would a day in your life @ Nium look like? As Director of Risk Management, you would: Be responsible for the end-to-end risk management strategies with a particular focus on fraud and financial risk Be the global subject matter expert from a risk perspective; develop, implement and adapt related policies, procedures, systems, and processes Drive improvements in our on-boarding processes and tools, developing adequate collateral calculation and requirements Conduct periodic customer reviews and audits to ensure existing programs are in line with the contractual agreement with NIUM and our risk is properly assessed and is underwritten within the approved level Act as the trusted risk advisor to all stakeholders across Nium, influence and drive the appropriate risk culture across the organization Effectively challenge adequacy and design of controls, identify process improvements, and implement prevention strategies to strengthen existing controls Develop and continuously enhance policies, processes, and controls for mitigating credit risk exposure and preventing fraud Promote an effective risk management framework by proactively identifying areas of financial risk exposure across processes and capabilities Partner with other teams across the company to support cross-functional projects, products development, processes, and methodologies Manage key components of the risk program and drive foundational enhancement to drive scalability, efficiency, automation, and effectiveness Maintain awareness of industry and regulatory developments and incorporate any required changes into the company's Risk strategy Requirements: What expertise & experiences would you need to have to play this kind of role? 10+ years of both credit and fraud risk management experience in banking, payment, or financial technology firms Must possess experience in card issuing and merchant acquiring Experienced in risk assessment and control, balancing risk efforts with business growth objectives Experience developing models and risk scoring is highly desirable Strong program and project management skills Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and embrace changes effortlessly Experience managing remote teams across various geographies Excellent communication and presentation skills BSc/BA in Law, Business, Finance or a related field Professional Risk Manager (PRM) certification is a plus Benefits: Comprehensive Health Insurance Home Office setup allowance Training & Development 24x7 Employee Assistance Program Recognition framework Generous Parental and Family leave

Hiring_Company: The Great Eastern Life Assurance Co Ltd
Job_Descriptions: Job Purpose To receive payments for new business, policy renewals, loans and miscellaneous accounts, perform screening in compliance with Company's Cash Collection Guidelines and MAS' Anti-Money Laundering Guidelines, and issue receipts for collections accepted. Update of credit card payment for eligible products. The Job Receive payments and update the respective systems for Life policies, Health Accident and Disability policies, Bancassurance policies, GE General Insurance policies, GEFA policies and Miscellaneous collections via cash, cheques, NETs and credit card terminal. For cash collections, to screen payment for compliance with the Company's ePay Collection Guidelines and file report to Compliance for any deviations from this guideline. File report for collection made with SGD 10,000 currency note, giving policy details and personal particulars of payer as in Identity Card. Check USD currency received for counterfeit notes. After screening and performing above, to accept payments and issue interim receipts, temporary receipts or official receipts. Screen cheques received in 24-hour quick cheque deposit box before updating systems. Call Distribution Reps for cheques that cannot be processed due to errors of commission/omission, post-dated cheques, and unauthorised third-party cheques. To update credit card applications or cancellations received within turnaround time Tally daily collections received via cash, cheques, credit cards and NETs to balance the accounts Prepare and submit Daily Collections Report by end of day. Fill up bank-in slips and AETOS report for day's collections. Stow collections in Cash Bag and lock Bag in safe. Hand over Cash Bag to AETOS by 9.00 am on T+1 day. Assist with document management and admin duties at Service Centre Ensuring customers comply with Covid-19 measures Other adhoc duties as assigned by manager Our Requirements At least GCE 'O' Level or higher Some experience in cashiering involving cash, NETs and credit card will be an advantage Working knowledge of Lotus Notes, Microsoft Word and Excel Fluent in English Knowledge in Mandarin and Chinesedialects will be an advantage Numerate and computer-literate Customer-oriented, patient and polite Comfortable to work in Frontline Environment Team player Ability to complete work on time and with accuracy Resilience to handle workloads during sales peak Flexibility to work extended hours on month-end of year-end Open to rotation at various service centers (namely PLQ, GEH, WGT) To all recruitment agencies: Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our email or our employees. We will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job_Title: MGR/AVP, Business Transformation Agent, Global Investment Banking - (210001LY)
Job_Descriptions: OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world’s most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody’s. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World’s Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Global Investment Banking offers funding solutions (debt, equity and mezzanine) to support the assets on the balance sheet of our corporate customers. We aim to be recognised as the preferred investment banking product and advisory provider in key Asian markets, by targeting the local customer franchise and focusing on cross-border products and services. Job Summary As a Business Transformation agent, you are constantly on the lookout for opportunities to improve business processes and efficiencies through automation and technological solutions. You manage the full life cycle of operation transformation initiatives, which include ideation, system formulation, project initiation, project execution and delivery. The aim is to deliver innovative solutions with architect efficient technology footprints for operational processes. This role sits within the Global Investment Banking division. Key Responsibilities: Work with respective business units to understand business needs and collaborate with users for solution planning and integration Conduct operation research and identify areas for operational automation Manage, build and deliver business process solutions to help improve efficiency Work with Technology in system design, user acceptance test, troubleshooting and ensuring that business transformation needs are being met in implementation Promote data automation and make use of data to help develop initiatives to improve productivity Understanding of artificial intelligence and machine learning Qualifications The ideal Candidate would meet the following requirements: Minimum 4 years’ experience in business transformation initiatives using technology, process improvement tools and methodologies. Experience in cross-functional stakeholder management, program/project management, contract negotiation and vendor management preferred Experience in engaging central bank for collaboration and pilot initiatives preferred Bachelor Degree holder in: Computer Science Computer Engineering Finance / Accounting Good understanding of banking and technology Good communication skills - able to effectively articulate technical concepts Strong interpersonal, coordination and planning skills Knowledge of programming language (e.g. Python, VBA, .NET, C, SQL, BATCH) and technologies (e.g. API, RPA, Sharepoint, digital signature, blockchain, cybersecurity, system architecture and AWS suite of services) preferred Knowledge of basic Bloomberg Terminal and Bloomberg Excel API usage preferred At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

Job_Title: Senior Audit Manager (Risk - ICAAP) - Senior Vice President (21350826)
Job_Descriptions: The Senior Audit Manager is a senior level management position responsible for managing a complex and critical unit within Internal Audit, in coordination with the Audit team. The overall objective of this role is to develop and execute a robust Audit Plan, and direct complex audit activities for a component of the business at a regional or country level. Responsibilities: Manage a team of Internal Audit professionals, recruit staff, lead professional development, build effective teams and manage a budget Deliver audit reports, Internal Audit and Regulatory issue validation and business monitoring and governance committee reports Lead reviews for all types of reviews, including the most complex, and review and approve Business Monitoring Quarterly Summaries Participate in major business initiatives and pro-actively advise and assist the business on change initiatives Implement integrated auditing concepts and technology, and follow trends in the Audit field and adapt them for the Audit function Identify solutions for a variety of complex and unique control issues, utilizing complex judgement and sophisticated analytical thought Analyze report findings, and recommend interventions where needed, proposing creative and pragmatic solutions to risk and control issues Partner with Directors and Managing Directors to develop approaches for addressing broader corporate emerging issues Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia. Grab Support SEO (Fin) works in close collaboration with Grab Financial Group (GFG) to deliver Grab’s vision to build the best mobile financial services platform for the people of SEA. The team has oversight of the finance-related Grab Support processes ranging from Payment services, Digital wallets, Lending, Insurance & Rewards. Get to know the Role: As the Regional Go-to-Person, card industry Subject Matter Expert to in-country GS teams on GrabPay card processes and troubleshooting and resolution advisor to customer issues Work hand in hand with GS teams (Team leaders & agents) to provide 1st contact resolution Educate, train and share market best practices to GSFI and GS teams on credit card industry, issuing, acquiring, merchant payment processes Identify existing process gaps as surfaced and support SEO (F) process experts, Product managers in issue investigations, case escalations, or stakeholder feedbacks Understand Grab business verticals and current GS Financial processes Support Head of SEO (Financial) and team in Grab Financials Group’s new product launches and ongoing process improvements and transformation across the region Maintain a Customer first attitude The day-to-day activities: Respond to non-BAU case inquiries on GrabPay Card from GSFI Ops teams regionally on a daily basis Conduct training and assimilation programs for newly hired / existing GSFI agents/team leaders Share, educate GS on Card industry practices, industry languages, scheme card policies and standard operating procedures Quality check GSFI agents to ensure adherence to pre-defined customer issue handling SOPs and to be the consultant for any exceptional cases or deviations Work directly with Team Service Champions, Country Operations leads, product owners and internal stakeholders for escalations, investigations, consolidate training materials in knowledge base. The Must-Haves: Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or related disciplines >7 years’ managerial experience in the card industry, from issuing or acquiring organisations or card schemes, in customer service or operations roles Solid in-depth understanding of end to end credit/debit card ecosystem, transaction processing and economics Familiar with card industry dispute and chargeback processes and scheme rules Knowledge of digital wallet landscape across the SEA countries is preferred Regional Customer Service experience in financial industry across SEA markets is preferred Have an open mind and willing to impart and share knowledge with Grabbers from different countries and backgrounds Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Customer-centric and attention to detail Training experience is a plus ~30% travel across Grab’s markets in SEA (once COVID-19 situation improves and travel opens up)

About the Team In Finance, we work hand-in-hand with leaders across the company to ensure smooth, disciplined execution of strategic business objectives. In this team, you will be working to attract the most appropriate capital partners for our business. This team is primarily responsible for defining and communicating the Grab story for investors. The team also aims to collect and provide market feedback and competitive intelligence that can be helpful to executives or pertinent working groups within Grab. The team works closely with a wide variety of groups to deeply understand the underlying business dynamics at Grab, as well as our investment priorities, and strategic goals. About the Role As the Investor Relations Senior Associate for Asian and outside of US investors, you will work closely with other members of the Investor Relations team and our Global Head of Investor Relations to position Grab strongly and maintain relationships with investors and analysts. You will play a key role in collecting and analyzing information that will inform our narrative, participate in the quarterly earnings process & owning key earnings deliverables, managing analyst and investor relationships, building Asia investor targeting strategies, and managing various investor events in Asia. A successful candidate will: 1) collect and synthesize external information on our business, industry, and shareholder composition, 2) build relationships with internal business line operators as well as teams in finance, communications, and policy, 3) produce analysis and documents for internal and external communication, particularly around earnings, 4) help establish internal processes that maximize the effectiveness and efficiency of the Investor Relations function, and 5) build relationships with investors and analysts. You’re excited about this opportunity because you will… Have an opportunity to learn our business and industry at a deep level Work closely with senior leaders in all areas of the company to craft and reinforce key narratives Analyze competitive behavior, market trends, shareholder concerns and other factors to enhance investor communications and corporate strategy Work with buy-side investors and sell-side analysts to communicate our strategy and build a feedback loop Help prepare quarterly earnings materials, investor presentations, and shareholder intelligence reports Have the opportunity to prove yourself and serve larger roles in the organization over time We’re excited about you because… You have a Bachelor's Degree or greater You have 1 to 3 years of experience working in investor relations, sell-side research, investment management, or investment banking Open to working in Singapore You are self-motivated with a history of taking on expanding roles You have strong familiarity with financial modeling and valuation You communicate in a way that inspires confidence CFA designation (or progress towards it)

Get to know our Team: The Singapore Operations team oversees, shapes and grows the business in Grab Singapore. We contribute towards Grab’s vision of being Southeast Asia’s superapp by providing everyday services that matter most to consumers in Singapore. We develop and execute business strategies that help us achieve our vision in serving our community. As part of the Singapore Operations team, the Merchant and Payment Operations team work alongside the business verticals (GrabFood, GrabMart, GrabExpress, GrabforBusiness and GrabPay) to enable the various strategic initiatives and ensure the core operations continue to run smoothly. We are the voice of all types of merchants in Grab Singapore (e.g. GrabFood, GrabMart, GrabPay, etc) and we advocate for solutions that best meet their needs. This would require close collaboration with various cross functional teams e.g Regional, Finance, Product, Automation, Support teams. We also oversee the payment and fund flow operation processes across our various partners including drivers, merchants and clients in the different verticals. Get to know the Role: This role sits within the Merchant and Payment Operations team. We are looking for a strong candidate to manage processes which may affect payments and reporting to merchants. You will have the chance to work with the various cross functional teams in identifying gaps in existing process and support process experts, product managers in issue investigations, case escalations, or stakeholder feedbacks As we thrive in a fast-paced industry where we continuously realign business needs and seek new opportunities. This role has the opportunity to expand within the Merchant and payment operations team. The day-to-day activities: Deliver strategic projects by working closely with business owners and product managers to roll out new features and build payment operational processes Liaise closely with business lines to manage and ensure smooth fund flow to and from Grab’s merchant-partners Act as the voice of merchants and feedback internally to drive payments process excellence Manage Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) and monitor service standards of agents supporting the team’s daily operations through performance measurement and reporting General project management and reporting, collaborate extensively with stakeholders in different verticals Must-haves: Bachelor degree in a related area of study with strong academic credentials Minimum 4 years of relevant payments / operations project management experience, preferably working in fast and entrepreneurial environments. Process-oriented as well as strong organizational skills with a hands-on mentality Demonstrated ability in problem solving, structured thinking and decision making Customer centric mindset and the willingness to challenge the status quo High proficiency in Excel is a must Self-motivated, able to work independently and adapt to fast-changing dynamic, ambiguous environments Have a positive attitude and can-do spirit, come across as fun, easy-going, vibrant, and creative Team player, excellent interpersonal & communication skills, good attitude Bonus points: Prior experience in digital payment landscape, online food, grocery delivery Accounting knowledge Python, SQL, R knowledge Working knowledge of software tools such as Salesforce, Zendesk, Tableau, Power BI Prior experience in internal controls/ audit

Job_Title: Personal Financial Consultant - Global Consumer Financial Services [2100012S]
Job_Descriptions: Personal Financial Consultant - Global Consumer Financial Services (Ind) - (2100012S) OCBC opens doors to new opportunities. Start your career with OCBC as a Personal Financial Consultant! At OCBC we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. As Singapore’s longest established local bank, we have a global network of more than 450 branches and representative offices in more than 15 countries and territories. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! Global Consumer Financial Services serves almost 3 million customers across Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia and China. In Singapore, our customer proposition caters to different life-stages and needs, ranging from Mighty Savers for children and young families, FRANK by OCBC for youths and young working adults to OCBC Premier Banking for affluent individuals. Besides being the pioneer in various banking products and services which include FRANK by OCBC, full-service Sunday Banking and our award-winning Online Banking, we are also the market leader for Bancassurance sales. What is it like being a Personal Financial Consultant at OCBC? As a Personal Financial Consultant, you will be based at one of our island-wide Branches and will provide comprehensive, one-stop financial advisory services to customers through the active promotion and cross-selling of our full range of wealth management products that include insurance, loans, unit trusts and structured deposits. With an emphasis on consultative selling to meet customers’ needs, you will also proactively build and manage long-term customer relationship and provide good after-sales service to them. To help you succeed in your role, you will join our structured training program during the first 6 weeks of your career with us. Thereafter you will also have at least 5 training days every year to help you further develop your career and keep your skills sharp and up-to-date with the latest developments in the industry. As a successful Personal Financial Consultant, you will have the option to take your career forward by either pursuing our Management Route, on the path of becoming a Branch Manager one day, or the Sales Route, growing into a Senior Relationship Manager working with premier private clients. Plus, as a top performer, you will be invited to trips, visiting great locations across the world from Paris, Barcelona to London and many more. *LI-ZY Qualifications The successful candidate should be able to demonstrate the following selection criteria: Preferably has a Degree or a Diploma with at least 2 years of relevant retail banking sales experience. Results-oriented go-getter who works well under pressure. Prepared to have flexible working hours that may include working on weekends. Candidates with more than 2 years of relevant financial advisory experiences and  proven sales records will be considered for Senior Personal Financial Consultant position.

Enterprise Architect - BFSI Role: Enterprise Architect, BFSI Geographical Coverage: ASEAN Base Location: Singapore Summary of Role Do you have a passion for architecting complex IT solutions? We are seeking a talented Enterprise Architect to join our growing Multi-Service Integration organization. In this role, you will be an integral part of the client service team, solutioning large, multi-tower engagements across multiple business units. An enterprise architect is responsible for the design of one or more applications or services within an organization and is typically part of a solution development team. He or she must have a balanced mix of technical and business skills, and will often work with technical architects for strategic direction. The main focus is on the technical decisions being made regarding the solution and how they impact the business outcomes. You will craft top-notch solutions for our clients' transformation and outsourcing requirements. You will define and drive business-IT solutions that use innovative business processes, architectural and technical frameworks to provide client partners with viable, high value solutions to complex business problems. Our solutions are typically a combination of Digital, BPO, applications development, applications management and infrastructure services. This elite opportunity requires prior professional experience as an enterprise architect, with a consistent track record of running and winning deals. Role Responsibilities Shall perform the role of a trusted technology advisor / Enterprise solution architect Is expected to drive large transformation work across key clientele - Existing and new Is expected to be part of large transformation programs and specifically platform driven /enabled transformation programs Whiteboard > shape up the client thought process > evolve a conceptual solution > work with the eco-system and provide directions to the independent solution streams > stitch it together > iterate with the client and other technology architects deriving from a business need. Other technology architects include: Technology architecture Component Architecture Application architecture Information Architecture Integration Architecture Hardware Architecture Network, Hosting Architecture Deployment / Cloud Architecture Be integral part of pursuits with the Service line Sales / Pursuit leader / Client Partner community along with the deal team which may comprise of other architects Once sales are completed, the role may sometimes transition into delivering the solution that has been sold and continue to be the trusted advisor to the client Will report into the solutions leader for the Geo The role will be measured on the following KRAs: TCV influenced Net new revenue influenced CXO Relationship index in the target market CSAT on programs being run Net influence in building transformational program solutioning, and management capabilities Skills & Experience Minimum 12-15 years of experience in solutioning for large complex programs Preferable to have experience in supporting pursuits and delivering multiple transformation AND / OR other packaged solutions supporting value chains across various Industries Need to have a good understanding of the Banking, Financial Services & Insurance (BFSI) as a whole across LOBs Need to have significant experience in the APAC region designing and Implementing transformation programs Excellent verbal, written communication skills and executive presence Preferable to have a Tech advisory background with BFSI clients across Geos Necessary to have had hands on experience in solutioning large transformation deals Need to be familiar with various deal constructs and engagement models for stitching large transformation deals Familiarity and hands on experience with most technology clusters - MS, UBM, Java, Oracle, ERP, Open standards / TOGAF / industry standard frameworks and various common cloud platforms Familiar with the latest trends and common solutions on Data Management & Analytics, AI, Blockchain, IOT, Digital Engineering principles Ability to understand the broad strategy of the enterprise, recommend solutions propositions keeping in mind the entire client eco-system which is fit for purpose Ability to have conversations and present propositions to the CXO group and carry the relationship along driven by content Ability to derive and drive development of executable solution from a defined business need / architecture towards an executable solution

Job_Title: Head of Market and Liquidity Risk (Digital Bank)
Job_Descriptions: This newly created Head of Market and Liquidity Risk role will cover a broad range of items associated with International Asset and Liability Management including interest rate risk and foreign exchange risk. Our client is one of the fastest growing financial institution in the region which manages a wide range of portfolio globally. With their creativity and various exciting platforms, they have been ensuring that technology becomes a key enabler for their operations in order to provide a seamless customer experience. Description Reporting to the CRO, the Head of Market and Liquidity risk will be involved in:- Crafting and setting up the market and liquidity risk management framework, policies and processes for the bank. Working closely with the treasury team to formulate liquidity management strategies such as liquidity risk management, capital cost and capital adequacy requirements. Monitoring market risk to ensure that they are within market risk thresholds, limits and constraints. Preparing relevant reports to senior management. Profile To qualify, the potential Head of Market and Liquidity Risk should meet the following criteria:- A recognised Bachelor's Degree in Economics, Finance or a related field. At least 10 years of relevant experience from the financial industry in market and liquidity risk management . Strong knowledge in the foreign exchange markets and international financial markets. Confident communicator with the ability to interact at all levels. Job Offer Our client is providing a unique opportunity in Singapore to help grow their footprint in the region. As this is a leadership role, remuneration and bonuses will be in line with market. To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Devan Nanthacumar on +65 6416 9879.

Life at Grab: At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia. Get to know the team: The Singapore Safety team is responsible for all safety-related aspects of the platform and directly supports all Grab’s business verticals and teams across Singapore. This team drives initiatives to improve User Safety (consumers, driver-partners, merchants): accidents, harm, food safety and hygiene management, pandemic concerns, and crime by influencing tech solutions, local policies, communications and training as well as sharpening internal processes. Get to know the role: Safety is the number one priority at Grab. This is a highly visible role with a high degree of responsibility but also one of the most unique roles at Grab that allows you to deliver maximum positive change and impact on the lives of our users. The Day-to-Day Activities: Own safety-related programmes, processes and policies for Singapore and influence strategic direction by supporting country management with trends, insights and recommendations for the business. Challenge existing ways of working, operation flows and policies to make sure we continue to always protect our passengers, drivers and merchants as priority. Initiate and drive challenging discussions and new ideas with cross-functional leaders in Singapore (for example, business heads, operations, public affairs) on execution strategies Collaborate cross-functionally with on-ground teams (driver-engagement teams, marketing, legal, operations) on execution strategies for product, policy, comms rollouts with a focus on ensuring safety risks are mitigated while being sensitive to on-ground concerns - You will be directly responsible for collecting necessary feedback and balancing between safety and business needs Be the lead for all safety-related crises for Singapore and involve leadership where needed Reporting of Safety success metrics to country management and develop strategy and plan for Grab Safety Singapore Represent Grab on response to victim’s family, how much support to provide, how we can do more (with Singapore leadership alignment) Establish and maintain partnerships with authorities and agencies that are relevant to establishing or elevating safety standards The Must-Haves: Must have at least 7-8 years of relevant working experience, equivalent to a senior manager or head of department role Background in operations, strategy or both. Should be comfortable with drawing up analysis, trends and insights independently. Wants and enjoys a role with full accountability. Must have relevant experience in a leading or driving role and be hands-on when necessary Strong communicator. Comfortable with raising difficult conversations and ability to present to country management Solid stakeholder management. In return, you will get an opportunity to expand your skills into a number of different areas - from systems administration through to backend coding, integration with vendor systems, cloud automation and security, SRE and more. Job description You will be responsible for the layout of High-End Integrated Analog Products for applications in Mobile, Tablets and Wireless Charger. As a member of the product development (layout) team, you will be in-charge of: Translation of schematic designs into mask layouts. Profile Graduated with a Degree or Diploma in Electrical/Electronic Engineering with a specialization in Microelectronics. Minimum 5 years of related experience in custom layout. Strong layout skills in understanding of critical matching, electro-migration, latch-up and ESD. Experience in CMOS and BCD process technologies. About this role As the Head of Asia-Pacific Credit Research within BlackRock’s Asian Credit and Fixed Income (FI) group, the successful candidate will be responsible for researching alpha generating investment ideas in Asian credit markets, driving the credit research agenda feeding into the Asian and global credit platforms, leading and managing a team of credit research analysts, and leveraging investment expertise across BlackRock’s wider investment research platform including but not limited to US and European FI, credit, and equities platforms. Key Responsibilities: Alpha generation Conduct deep fundamental research to generate alpha ideas for Asian and global portfolios Present alpha ideas to the broader team and PMs Partner with PMs in developing country and sector views using fundamental models Set credit research agenda and deepen research process Craft and deliver a broad research agenda focusing on instilling best practice and investment excellence to deliver strong and consistent alpha Drive and monitor proactive idea generation on existing and/or new alpha opportunities Monitor and constructively challenge investment priorities and execution against those priorities, in coordination with the PMs and respective investment mandates Target best practices and standardization of the investment process across the platform Managing APAC research team Cultivate and maintain a high performing culture founded on meritocracy, skills, and teamwork Encourage versatility of the team across different credit products and different investment processes; monitor and incentivize ownership across all products Support the development and growth of talent Active participant on Investment Committees Along with other members of the Investment Committees, the candidate will be responsible for vetting and the approval of potential investment opportunities within the Asia-Pacific opportunistic private credit and loan strategies Attend monthly and ad-hoc meetings to ensure established processes and controls are adhered to, review due diligence and investment committee memos, challenge research thesis and review financial model assumptions Oversight of monitoring performance and harvesting post the portfolio build Leveraging BlackRock’s wider investment research platform Develop relationships across BlackRock, including but not limited to US and European FI, credit, and equities platforms, to leverage and improve our insights Key Requirements: Proven track record of generating alpha, specifically across Asia Pacific Credit. Demonstrated fundamental research, analytical skills, with strong attention to detail Extensive China credit research experience and the ability to communicate with China clients in local language Excellent quantitative modeling and valuation skills Ability to manage competing workloads effectively, and deliver quality work on schedule Effective communication skills, both written and verbal Connections within the industry and proven ability to build and sustain internal and external relationships Experience managing numerous investment professionals in a complex, global environment and demonstrate the ability to work more broadly within an organization where information-sharing is critical to the success of all teams across asset classes Outstanding interpersonal characteristics, reputation, and team orientation, which will enable her/him to command the confidence, loyalty, and respect of investment colleagues and external constituents Experience in hiring, setting expectations for, managing and mentoring individuals and/or teams Our benefits To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children’s educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment – the one we make in our employees. It’s why we’re dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit careers.blackrock.com | www.blackrock.com/corporate | Instagram: @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer.  We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law. BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Position description Posting title Senior / Engineer, Firmware M/F Regular/Temporary Regular Job description Our next sustainable technology can start with You At ST, we are 46,000 creators and makers of semiconductor technologies, and a leader in innovation with 8,100 people working in R&D. Job description As a Firmware engineer, you are at the center of many activities. You are the one making the bridge between the system requirements and the IC capabilities. You interface with architects and IC design teams. Software is a key element when it comes to get the quintessence and the ultimate performances from the IC. In complex systems, some critical functions can also be implemented in software. You can have to deal with real time software, including real time operating system, communication protocols. You can have to deal with filtering and signal processing. You are responsible of all the project steps, from the specification, development, testing to the integration and validation on the IC. From this software view, you are also involved in customer related activities like documentation (user manual, …) and customer support for complex cases. In this role it is important to keep pace on the latest technical solutions and technologies, be innovative and creative, take initiative and be autonomous, and work as part of a team of technical experts. Profile You have graduated from an engineering or equivalent level. You are looking for a first professional experience or have a first experience in Firmware Development and wish to extend your knowledge in this field. You have good knowledge on software programming (C/C++, Python, …) You may have basic skills on digital signal processing. You are open minded with a good level of listening skills and enjoy working in a diversified team. You are autonomous, analytical, motivated and desire to propose innovative and competitive ideas for the development of new successful products. Position location Job location Asia-Pacific, Singapore, Ang Mo Kio Candidate criteria Education level required 4 - Bachelor degree Experience level required 2-5 years Requester Desired start date 15/09/2021

Voluntary Self-Identification For government reporting purposes, we ask candidates to respond to the below self-identification survey. Completion of the form is entirely voluntary . Whatever your decision, it will not be considered in the hiring process or thereafter. Any information that you do provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file. As set forth in Interactive Brokers’s Equal Employment Opportunity policy, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected group status under any applicable law. Race & Ethnicity Definitions If you believe you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans listed below, please indicate by making the appropriate selection. As a government contractor subject to the Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measure the effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA. Classification of protected categories is as follows: A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability. A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service. An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense. An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985. Form CC-305 OMB Control Number 1250-0005 Expires 05/31/2023 Why are you being asked to complete this form? We are a federal contractor or subcontractor required by law to provide equal employment opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. We are also required to measure our progress toward having at least 7% of our workforce be individuals with disabilities. To do this, we must ask applicants and employees if they have a disability or have ever had a disability. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we ask all of our employees to update their information at least every five years. Identifying yourself as an individual with a disability is voluntary, and we hope that you will choose to do so. Your answer will be maintained confidentially and not be seen by selecting officials or anyone else involved in making personnel decisions. Completing the form will not negatively impact you in any way, regardless of whether you have self-identified in the past. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of federal contractors under Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act, visit the U.S. Department of Labor’s Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp. How do you know if you have a disability? You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to: Autism Autoimmune disorder, for example, lupus, fibromyalgia, rheumatoid arthritis, or HIV/AIDS Blind or low vision Cancer Cardiovascular or heart disease Celiac disease Cerebral palsy Deaf or hard of hearing Depression or anxiety Diabetes Epilepsy Gastrointestinal disorders, for example, Crohn's Disease, or irritable bowel syndrome Intellectual disability Missing limbs or partially missing limbs Nervous system condition for example, migraine headaches, Parkinson’s disease, or Multiple sclerosis (MS) Psychiatric condition, for example, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, PTSD, or major depression 1Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries. At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. Associate Director, Lending Solutions Specialist This position is in the Banking Organization Unit Solutions Specialist team within the Sales Division at Moody's Analytics. The Solutions Specialist role is charged with the pre-sales activities for their respective territories and product. They support the sales process by qualifying prospects identified by sales and managing sales cycles with sales in charge with prospects account to closure. Typical activities are as follows: Answer to functional and technical queries of RFIs and RFPs Assist Sales teams in responding to sales related queries Generate pre-sales support documents and demonstration environments Conduct presentations and demonstrations of the software solutions to prospects and clients Build and maintain use cases and demonstration setups of specific software modules Prepare and conduct product workshops and/or proof of concepts on clients/prospect sites Work closely with implementation services to ensure the solutions to be implemented will meet client's expectations Work closely with product management and marketing team to respectively improve and market assigned products Assist sales agents, distributors and partners during the sales process. The ideal candidate for this Lending Solutions Specialist role requires subject matter expertise and relevant work experience in end-to-end Lending/Loan Origination process including but not limited to borrower onboarding, credit assessment, deal structuring, deal workflow approval, covenant monitoring, etc. The role is also expected to cover other related solution including credit modelling related solutions leveraging on Moody's Analytics credit data, credit models, credit modeling and lifecycle management platform and credit rating advisory capabilities. This role is based in Singapore and is expected to be supporting the pre-sales activity for South East Asia with ad-hoc support for other regions in APAC or South Asia as required. Degree in IT, Engineering, Science or Mathematics with at least 3-4 years relevant experience in a Banking environment with either Banks, software house, consulting firms or integrators with preferably presales experience of 2 or more years Strong knowledge of commercial credit origination, including C&I, CRE, SME/SBL Familiarity with software technologies such as PostgreSQL, R, Public Cloud and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) Comfortable to perform Proof-of-Concept alone and performing tasks like configurating the software system and coding when necessary and multi-task with prospect presentations and solution selling. Highly organized with excellent presentation skills and sales consulting knowledge Clear written and oral communication skills with an ability to communicate complex concepts in a easily understandable manner to diverse audience. Position requires travel across APAC which is self-managed and planned. Fluency in English and preferably proficient The Department / Team: Risk & Finance Solutions team of Moody's Analytics, provides world-class subject matter expertise to the financial services industry around the globe. Our product suite and advisory capabilities allow our clients to understand, measure and manage uncertainty, helping them to improve their understanding of both short and long term financial market risk exposure and pricing. Global Sales Moody's is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody's (NYSE: MCO) is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions. Our data, analytical solutions and insights help decision-makers identify opportunities and manage the risks of doing business with others. We believe that greater transparency, more informed decisions, and fair access to information open the door to shared progress. With over 11,000 employees in more than 40 countries, Moody's combines international presence with local expertise and over a century of experience in financial markets. Learn more at moodys.com . Moody's Analytics provides financial intelligence and analytical tools supporting our clients' growth, efficiency and risk management objectives. The combination of our unparalleled expertise in risk, expansive information resources, and innovative application of technology, helps today's business leaders confidently navigate an evolving marketplace. At MIS, our workplace culture supports our mission to be the Agency of Choice for our customers, employees and future employees. Our Culture focuses on Excellence and embodies behavioral qualities such as Integrity, Responsiveness, Collaboration, Respect and Passion. Our people are our core asset and we look beyond outcomes to ensure that behaviors and interactions matter.

SCOPE The overall scope of the job includes serving food and beverages to guests in the assigned outlet, providing a courteous, professional, efficient and flexible service consistent with the standards of the hotel and in line with Kempinski’s DNA values in order to encourage sales and maximize guest satisfaction. OVERALL OBJECTIVES The job of Food & Beverage Intern is executed satisfactorily when: All rules & regulations are strictly adhered to within the hotel including hotel’s policy on fire and safety as well as hygiene regulations including Basic Food Hygiene. A high quality of product and service is maintained in the outlet. The assigned outlet is developed in an entrepreneurial manner, looking for opportunities to generate more business at all times. MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES Ensure that the Restaurant Outlets are clean, neat and tidy. Greeting and seating guests according to Kempinski standards. After seating, informing guests about specials and promotional menu as per standard procedures. Make suggestions and answer questions regarding food, beverages and service at the guest’s table. Take food and beverage orders from guests and relay the order to kitchen staff and main-service bar as appropriate. Process guests’ orders in a timely manner whilst verifying that all items are prepared according to guests’ requests and standards. Keep a discreet eye on the guests to ensure they are satisfied with the food and service. Respond to any additional requests and determine when the course / meal has been completed. After each course, remove dirty dishes from table. After the meal, clean and reset the table according to the outlet standards. Present the bill to the guests according to the outlet standards. Up-sell or promote all specials advertised in the outlet as well promoting slow moving items. To have a thorough understanding and knowledge of all Food and Beverage items, ingredients and prices in the menu and the ability to recommend Food & Beverage combinations and up sell alternatives. Responsible for all side duties described in the job task check list and to complete all side work prior to the opening and closing of the outlet. Follow the cash handling procedures and process all guest orders through MICROS before any dish or beverage is served as per standards. Stock the work stations as required. Clean equipment, polish silverware, china and glassware and fold napkins. Acquiring a working knowledge of hotel, in-house facilities and local information to respond to guest questions in these areas as required. Demonstrate teamwork by cooperating and assisting co-workers as needed. Keep immediate Supervisor or Outlet Manager promptly and fully informed of all problems or unusual matter of significance. Handle guest enquiries in a courteous and efficient manner and report guest complaints or problems to the Supervisor or Outlet Manager if no immediate solution can be found and assure follow up with guests. Handle all food, beverage and operating equipment with care, in order to minimize breakage / wastage. Ability to rotate throughout each of the food & beverage outlets. Perform all duties and responsibilities in a timely and efficient manner in accordance with established company policies and procedures to achieve overall objectives of this position. Understand and strictly adhere to the Rules & Regulations established in the Employees Handbook and the Hotel’s policy on Fire, Hygiene, Health & Safety. Ensure that all potential and real hazards are reported and rectified immediately. Report to duty punctually wearing the correct uniform and nametag at all times. Additional responsibilities and tasks can be added at any time according to the needs of the business and of the hotel. REQUIREMENTS Warm, pleasant, friendly and confident, with good interpersonal skills. Possess good command of English Organization: Kempinski Hotels Location: The Capitol Kempinski Hotel Singapore Job Type: Internship Job Level: Entry Level Staff Schedule: Full-time Job Posting: Jan 18, 2022 Unposting Date: N/A Job Number: 22000031

Johnson & Johnson Consumer Health is recruiting for a Supplier Quality Regional Leader for Asia Pacific, located in Singapore. Our Consumer Health companies produce many of the world's most trusted brands, among them TYLENOL®, MOTRIN®, LISTERINE®, NEUTROGENA®, NICORETTE®, NEOSTRATA® and DR CI:LABO®. Each one of our consumer businesses adopts innovative science to create products that anticipate consumer needs and build experiences that help them live healthy, vibrant lives. The Regional Leader will own the regional Supplier Quality organization for Consumer Health in Asia-Pacific, actively working with Procurement, regional Q&C teams, R&D, Manufacturing and Manufacturing Sciences & Technology. The scope of this role includes all categories of materials: packaging, chemicals, APIs and others. This role is accountable for the reliable supply of materials to the J&J Consumer Health manufacturing network. He or she will lead a team across several countries in APAC, ensuring the development and capabilities of the organization are aligned to meet business requirements. His or her leadership of the Supplier Quality organization will ensure continuous improvement in quality, reliability, and cost. Key Responsibilities: •    Provide regional Supplier Quality leadership to Asia-Pacific internal and external manufacturing sites on direct materials, and material governance activities, in compliance with regulatory, J&J and regional standards •    Lead and develop the Supplier Quality group in Asia-Pacific to meet Q&C requirements and business expectations •    Report on performance and issues via metrics and reports, including collecting data, analyzing trends, and preparing reports as required •    Develop suppliers and direct material quality strategies in close collaboration with the key business stakeholders to achieve objectives in the areas of quality, reliability, and cost efficiency programs •    Represent Asia-Pacific in global Supplier Quality team, ensuring the regional considerations are well represented globally •    Build an engaged workforce and establishes a plan for continuous staff development; ensures a talent pipeline for the team •    Actively demonstrate values of diversity, equity and inclusion to support J&J objectives, and the development of an actively inclusive culture Qualifications Minimum Bachelor of Science in a life science or technical field. Experience and Skills: Required: Minimum 10+ years of experience in Pharmaceutical, Consumer/Cosmetic, Medical Device or similarly regulated industries, with leadership experience in Quality, Compliance, R&D or other technical functions Experience in establishing productive working relationships with Health Authorities Experience with external suppliers, external manufacturers or other external relationship building Experience on a local or regional leadership team Experience leading a diverse community of professionals Experienced leader, decision maker and constructive challenger Excellent communication, influencing and collaboration skills Preferred: Experience in risk management and collaboration in an international environment Other: This role requires 20-30% of international travel. Job_Title: Software Engineer/Senior Software Engineer, Full Stack - Mobility, Automation and Platform Excellence, Deliveries and Experiences
Job_Descriptions: Life at  Grab: At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia. Get to know the Role : As such, we are seeking talented & passionate Engineers to join our team, you will have opportunities to work on multiple backend services as well as webapps. It is very important that our team members take initiative to identify problems and have the right mindset and skillsets to solve them. The day-to-day activities: Design and enhance cutting edge services in GO language setting a high standard for availability, scalability, latency, and efficiency of Grab's range of products Build and deploy performant modern web applications in React, Redux, Webpack, ES6, and Flow Work with the engineering team to explore and create new design/architectures geared towards scale and performance Participate in code and design reviews to maintain our high development standards Engage in service capacity and demand planning, software performance analysis, tuning, and optimization Collaborate with product and experience teams to define and prototype feature specifications Work closely with infrastructure team in building and scaling back-end services as well as performing root cause analysis investigations Design, build, analyze and fix large-scale systems Learn full-stack performance tuning and optimization Debug and modify complex, production software that serve millions of users in Southeast Asia The must-haves : A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology or related fields From 1 to 8+ years of experience in software engineering in a distributed systems environment (hiring across junior to senior level) Strong Computer Science fundamentals in algorithms and data structures Familiarity with running large scale web services; understanding of systems internals and networking are a necessary Strong understanding of system performance and scaling Possess excellent communication, sharp analytical abilities with proven design skills, able to think critically of the current system in terms of growth and stability Strong programming skills in Java / Scala / Python and javascript but willing to work on Golang Nice-to-haves: Experience with Go programming language. Experience with Flutter, Kotlin, or Swift programming languages We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique. About Grab Grab is the leading superapp platform in Southeast Asia, providing everyday services that matter to consumers. Today, the Grab app has been downloaded onto millions of mobile devices, giving users access to over 9 million drivers, merchants, and agents. Grab offers a wide range of on-demand services in the region, including mobility, food, package and grocery delivery services, mobile payments, and financial services across 428 cities in eight countries Join us today to drive Southeast Asia forward, together.
